In the single inorganic halide perovskites, an emerging
interpretation is that the potential energy minima due to
octahedral tilting are, at least partly, occupied on the
timescale of thermal vibrations even above the apparent
symmetry cubic phase then appears as a spatial and/or

describable in a renormalized phonon picture.
To this end, we have performed AIMD simulations for a
set of temperatures to first obtain equilibrium volumes
and then used the temperature-dependent effective potential
method to, at each temperature, map out
are the elements of the second-, third-, and fourth-
We fit IFCs of increasing order in a sequential fashion;
i.e., we first find the best possible fit of the AIMD forces
using just the second-order IFCs, then fit the third-order
IFCs to the residual atomic forces, and then similarly for the
fourth-order IFCs. This fitting scheme ensures that
is the largest, while the effect of

. As we will show below, however, this
